subject: Education
title: Serve and Return: The Conversation That Builds Brains
description: One-minute skill: Serve and Return: The Conversation That Builds Brains.

hook.text: A baby points at a dog. The parent says 'Yes! A dog! Woof woof!' That exchange builds a brain.

buildup.text: Serve and return interactions are the back-and-forth exchanges between caregiver and child.

discovery.text: These interactions build neural connections, especially in areas responsible for communication and social skills.

twist.text: A parent distracted by a phone misses dozens of serve-and-return opportunities every hour.

climax.text: The quantity and quality of these exchanges in the first years predict language ability at age 5.

punchline.text: Every time you respond to a baby, you're wiring their brain for connection.

quiz.question: What are 'serve and return' interactions?
options: Back-and-forth exchanges between caregiver and child that build neural connections
A type of physical therapy for infants
A teaching method used only in preschools
